review_title: Some great coworkers, but staff is treated terribly

- There are some fantastic people you'd be working with (depends on department). Working with students can also be very rewarding.

cons:

- The "Bentley Bubble" is extremely homogenous, so good luck if you're not a straight cis abled white man who's already worked there for 10 years.

pros: friendly people and lots of dogs
cons: i have no cons to say

pros:
I work in the administration.

Low stress environment with great benefits. Good morale in office thanks to low stress environment and reasonable deadlines for reports and finished projects.

School has narrow, specific focus. This is a good thing for the organization. Working in administration, I feel like I'm furthering the goals of the university and serving its students.

Campus is pretty. Gym and library are great amenities for staff and a chance to interface with community members, including students and faculty.

Tuition remission is an A+!
cons:
While the pay is right for me and my circumstances, it may not attract or keep best talent forever.

Parking can be tough.

It's on a hill.

Some bureaucracy, which can be expected.

Some employees in administration can be petty and not play well with certain departments due to years-old conflicts. That's confusing to me. See above about bureaucracy.

review_title: Typical work study job for a school run like a business.
pros: The work study jobis an easy one, as many work study jobs are. Bentley University itself is well run organization. As you would expect of a school for mostly accountants, there are no budget problems plaguing this university like there are at so many others.
cons: As a work study employee, there are very limited opportunities for personal or professional growth, but with many random tasks to do, as I would assume is typical of a work study job. Not much opportunity to study.

pros: Beautiful campus, intelligent students, and great colleagues to work with.
cons: Underpaid adjunct teaching staff with few benefits and little representation within Administration. Discouraged and beat down the unionization of part-time teaching staff and discarded those seen as trouble-makers who clamored for better pay and working conditions. Business as usual at a business school.

pros:
The benefits.  4 day summer work weeks, week between Xmas and NY off, great retirement, support services. 

The people. The people who work at Bentley are really engaged with the institution and its students. They are a close knit community of people who *care*
cons: The former president was an amazing leader and visionary; it's hard for the new president to live up to the expectations set by the former leader, and to forge a new vision. As with any presidential transition, there is also transition at the topmost positions.

pros: Nice campus, most people are great to work with. Average compensation, substantial vacation time off (for most departments).
cons: Poor engagement of operational leadership, department directors engage in bullying behavior unrestrained by oversight (not just my own department but at least 2 others). Disappointed that a well-regarded business school disregards the value of applying good human resource management at the operational level. Poor work-life balance.

pros: There were some great people to work with and the teaching staff was very professional and dedicated.
cons: The pay for part time lecturing was not very much.  It would be helpful to have more support for the part time people and even better to have more full time positions available.

job_title: Bentley Computing Services in Waltham, MA
pros: Good staff and clients, diverse environment, great campus setting, good work environment, cafe's on campus, great support of many departments
cons:
One of the downsides is the low pay - even more so with the recent budget cuts Bentley has imposed on several departments.

Bentley also seem to treat the student workers as items to be disposed of.

pros: Lots of great colleagues, opportunity for growth and advancement, excellent benefits, very nice campus. A very good place to work, and
cons: Dreadful management at the senior administrative level. Significant momentum from 1998 to 2005 stalled when president's office vacant for two years. Never recovered that momentum due to ineffectual leadership.

pros: I really enjoyed my time at Bentley.  The athletics department immediately makes you feel like you are a part of the team, and the support for each team was remarkable.  I have not seen that kind of support at previous institutions.
cons: For me, the commute was a bit of a challenge, but that was mostly because I was coming from a difficult location.  Not accessible by T.

pros: Great community with a great athletic department at Bentley University. Coaches and players with the highest integrity.
cons: There won't be many issues as a camp counselor. Bring your "A" game and be ready to work. The staff/coaches are great at what they do and they expect a lot from those involved at Bentley.

review_title: Great work environment with a strong focus on quality of life.
pros:
+ Great Benefits
+ Great Stability
+ Great Work / Life balance
cons:
- Limited career advancement for staff
- Some employees are "lifers" which limits innovation and limits attracting new talent
- Bureaucratic culture dampens innovation

review_title: Phd and tenured Eliteness is excessive.
pros: Wonderful students, beautiful campus and mostly great co-workers.
cons: “Phd and Tenured eliteness” is not out in the open but it is discreetly very prevalent which can make the work environment for lecturers and staff very challenging.

pros: The students are terrific; the collaboration among the GB leaders and professors is great
cons: Short on space for adjuncts to meet with students during office hours

pros: With standard work weeks, a week off for Christmas, 4 day work weeks in the Summer, and a generous vacation package, Bentley is a very good place to work if you want a great work life balance.
cons: Departments can oftentimes operate in silos, making communication across the University difficult.

pros:

-Great work/life Balance

pros: Great benefits, including medical and dental, fantastic educational opportunities (free tuition for you and your family).  For most employees, Friday's off in the summer.
cons: People love their jobs, so the low turnover means that there's not a lot of growth opportunities.

pros: Work was chilled out. Schedule was flexible for the accounting department. Hours could be completed easily every week and when you could not, you good get extentions

pros: Bentley has a friendly and supportive administrative staff that made going to work enjoyable.
